f.81302: The Arabic word used is zakāt, which denotes purification and growth.

58:14.t: Have yousgnot seen those who allied themselves with a people upon whom is Allah’s wrath? They are neither of youplnor of them, and they swear to lies while they know(the truth).

58:15.t: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; evil indeed is what they used to do.

58:16.t: They took their oaths as a cover and barred(others)from the way of Allah, so for them is a demeaning punishment.

58:17.t: Neither their possessions nor their children will avail them anything against Allah. Those are the fellows of the Fire; therein they abide.

58:18.t: On the day when Allah resurrects them all together, they swear to Him as they swear to youpl, thinking that they are(standing)upon something. Undoubtedly, it is indeed they themselves who are the liars.

58:19.t: Satan has taken hold of them and so has caused them to forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Undoubtedly, it is indeed the party of Satan who are the losers.

58:20.t: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are among the most humiliated<sup foot_note="81303">1</sup>.

f.81303: They shall be humiliated in the Hereafter.

58:21.t: Allah has prescribed: “I will most surely overcome, I and My messengers.” Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, Almighty.

58:22.t: Yousgwill not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day loving those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brethren or their kinsfolk. Those—He has prescribed faith in their hearts and has aided them with a spirit from Him, and He will enter them into Gardens(of Paradise)beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide. Allah became well pleased with them and they became well pleased with Him. Those are the party of Allah. Undoubtedly, it is indeed the party of Allah who are the successful.

59:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and in the earth has been highly exalting Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

59:2.t: It is He who evicted those who denied among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first exodus1. Youpldid not think they would depart, and they thought their fortresses would protect them from Allah, but Allah came at them from where they never expected and threw terror into their hearts. They2wreck3their houses with their own hands and by the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O you who are endowed with sight(s).

f.81305: A grammatical shift from past tense to present tense, which serves to create a vivid portrait of past events.
f.81306: Qira’at: Abu ʻAmr read it as: “They vigorously wreck their houses . . .”
f.81304: The Jewish tribe of Banu al-Nadirwas besieged by the Muslims for trying to assassinate the Prophet (peace be upon him). An arbiter ruled that its members had to leave Madinah; some of them left to Khaybarwhile the rest left to the Levant.

59:3.t: Had Allah not prescribed evacuation for them, He would have punished them in the Earlier(Life), and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.

59:4.t: That is because they went against Allah and His Messenger, and whoever goes against Allah—indeed, Allah is stern in retribution.

59:5.t: Whatever palm tree youplcut down or left standing on its roots, then that was by Allah’s leave and that He may disgrace those who are defiantly disobedient.

59:6.t: And whatever Allah has turned over to His Messenger from them, you have spurred neither horse nor camel for them, but Allah gives authority to His messengers over whomever He wills, and Allah is All-Powerful over everything.

59:7.t: Whatever Allah has turned over to His Messenger from the people of the towns, then that is for Allah and for the Messenger and for the relative and the orphans and the destitutepland to the traveler in need, so thatit does notcirculate exclusively1between the wealthy among you. And whatever the Messenger brings you—accept it, and whatever he forbids you—abstain from it. And be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is stern in retribution.

f.81307: Qira’at: Abu Jaʻfar and Hisham read it as: “. . . so that a closed circuit is not created between the wealthy among you.”

59:8.t: (It is)for the poor immigrants1who were evicted from their homes and their possessions, seeking grace from Allah, and(His)good pleasure, and supporting Allah and His Messenger— those are the sincere.

f.81308: The Arabic word used is muhajereen, which refers to the Muslims of Makkahwho were forced to flee as refugees from their homes to Madinahwhere they were welcomed.

59:9.t: And(for)those who,before them,had settled in the homeland and(adopted)the faith—theylove those who emigrated to them and find no need in their chests for what has been brought to them, and they give them priority over themselves even if they themselves are needy. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his(inner)self—then it is those1who are the successful.

f.81309: A grammatical shift from singular to plural.

59:10.t: And those who came after them, saying, “Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who precededus in faith, and leave no malice in our hearts towards those who have attained faith. Our Lord, You are indeed Compassionate, Bestowing of mercy.”

59:11.t: Have yousgnot seen those who became hypocrites, saying to their brethren who denied among the People of the Scripture, “Indeed, if you are evicted, we will certainly depart with you and not obey anyone against you, ever, and should anyone combat you, we will certainly support you”? But Allah bears witness that they are certainly liars.

59:12.t: Indeed, if they are evicted, they will not depart with them; and indeed, if anyone combats them, they will not support them. And(even) if they do support them, they will(then) certainly turn their backs, then they will not be supported.

59:13.t: Indeed, fear of youplis surely more intense in their chests than fear of Allah; that is because they are people who do not comprehend.

59:14.t: They do not combat youplall together except from fortified strongholds or from behindwalls1. Their hostility towards each other is severe. Yousgwould think them united, but their hearts are diverse; that is because they are people who do not reason.

f.81310: Qira’at: Ibn Kathir and Abu ʻAmr read it as: “. . . or from behind a wall .”

59:15.t: Like those who shortly before them tasted the grievous consequences of their affairs, and for them is a painful punishment.

59:16.t: Like the example of Satan when he said to man, “Deny,” but when he had denied, he said, “I disown you; I fear Allah, Lord of all realms.”

59:17.t: So the consequence for both of them was<sup foot_note="81311">1</sup>that they are<sup foot_note="81312">2</sup>in the Fire, abiding therein, and such is the repayment of the unjust.

f.81311: Frequently the Qur’an addresses the events of the Hereafter in past tense, this grammatical shift should be pondered by the reader.
f.81312: A grammatical shift to present tense, which serves to create a vivid portrait of future events.

59:18.t: O you who have attained faith, be mindful of Allah, and let every soul look what it has put forth for tomorrow, and be mindful of Allah; indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

59:19.t: And doplnot be like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves; those are the defiantly disobedient.

59:20.t: Not equal are the fellows of the Fire and the fellows of the Garden(of Paradise); it is the fellows of the Garden who are the triumphant ones.

59:21.t: Had We sent this Recital1down upon a mountain, yousgwould have seen it(trembling)in reverence, crumbling in awe of Allah. And these parables We set forth for mankind, that they may reflect.

f.81313: The Arabic word used is Qur’anwhich literally means ‘recital’ or ‘recitation’.

59:22.t: He is Allah, besides Whom there is no god, the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest; He is the All-Merciful, the Bestower of mercy.

59:23.t: He is Allah, besides Whom there is no god, the King, the Holy, the Peace(Giver), the Believer, the Overseer, the Almighty, the Irresistible, the Sublime; Highly Exalted is Allah beyond what they associate.

59:24.t: He is Allah, the Creator, the Maker, the Designer; His are the Most Beautiful Names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth highly exalts Him, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

60:1.t: O you who have attained faith, do not take My enemies and your enemies as guardians, extending love towards them when they have denied what has come to you of the truth, evicting the Messenger and yourselves because you believe in Allah, your Lord—if you have set out to strive in My way and to seek My pleasure. How can you secretly express love towards them while I know better what you have hidden and what you have made public? And whoever of you does that has certainly strayed from the right way.

60:2.t: If they encounter youpl, they are enemies to you and they extend their hands and tongues against you with malice, for they would love that you become deniers.

60:3.t: Neither your relatives1nor your children will benefit you; on the Day of ResurrectionHewill decide2betweenyou, for Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

f.81315: Qira’at: Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir, Abu ʻAmr and Abu Jaʻfar read it as: “. . . on the Day of Resurrection a decision will be made between you . . .” Ibn ʻAmer read it as: “. . . on the Day of Resurrection youwill be separated . . .” All except for Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir, Abu ʻAmr, Abu Jaʻfar, Ibn ʻAmer, ʻAsem and Yaʻqub read it as: “on the Day of Resurrection He will separate you . . .”

60:4.t: Surely, there has always been an excellent role model for youplinAbraham1and those with him, when they said to their people, “We disown you and what you worship apart from Allah. We have disbelieved2in you, and enmity and hatred have surfaced between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone.” Except for the words of Abraham to his father, “I will ask forgiveness for you, though I cannot protect you from Allah.” “Our Lord, in You we have placed our trust, and to You we have turned penitent, for to You is the destiny.

f.81316: Qira’at: Though pronounced in Arabic as Ibrahim, Hisham read it as: “Abraham ”.

60:5.t: Our Lord, do not make us a means of trial for those who have denied, and forgive us, our Lord; You are indeed the Almighty, the All-Wise.”

60:6.t: Indeed, there has always been an excellent role model in them for youpl(and)for anyone who has been putting hope in Allah and(expecting)the Last Day. But whoever turns away—indeed, Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.

60:7.t: Hopefully, Allah will produce love between you and those of them whom you took for enemies, for Allah is All-Powerful, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

60:8.t: Allah does not forbid youplfrom those who have neither combated you over religion nor evicted you from your homes—that you deal with them very kindly and equitably. Indeed, Allah loves the equitable.

60:9.t: Rather, Allah forbids youplfrom1those who combated you over religion and evicted you from your homes and backed up(your enemies)in your eviction. And whoever takes them as guardians—those are the unjust.

f.81318: The prohibition is from befriending them or forming an alliance with them.

60:10.t: O you who have attained faith, when believing women come to you immigrating, test them; Allah knows better about their faith. And if youplfind them to be faithful, do not send them back to the deniers; they are not lawful for them1nor are they lawful for them2. But give them what they have spent3. And no sin is committed by you if you marry them, provided you give them their compensationg. And do not hold on to ties with unbelieving women, but demand what you have spent and let them demand what they have spent. This is Allah’s judgment—He judges among you, for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

f.81321: The dowries paid to the brides.

60:11.t: And if any of yourplwives should go over to the deniers and then you punish(them in retaliation), then give those whose wives have gone away the equivalent of what they had spent. And be mindful of Allah in whom you are believers.

60:12.t: O Prophet, if believing women come to you pledging allegiance to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor steal, nor fornicate, nor kill their children, nor commit perjury as to parenthood, nor disobey you in anything righteous—then accept their allegiance and ask Allah’s forgiveness for them; indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

60:13.t: O you who have attained faith, do not take for guardians people upon whom is Allah’s wrath—they have indeed despaired of the Hereafter as the deniers have despaired of the fellows of the graves.

61:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth has been highly exalting Allah, and He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

61:2.t: O you who have attained faith, why do you say what you do not do?

61:3.t: It is most loathsome to Allah that youplsay what you do not do.

61:4.t: Indeed, Allah loves those who combat in His way, lining up in ranks as though they were a compact structure.

61:5.t: And recall when Moses said to his people, “O my people, why do you hurt me, though you know that I am Allah’s Messenger to you?” And when they swerved, Allah caused their hearts to swerve, for Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

61:6.t: And recall when Jesus, son of Mary, said, “O Children of Israel, I am Allah’s Messenger to you, confirming what preceded me of the Torah and a bearer of glad tidings of a messenger who comes after me, whose name is Ahmad.” Yet when he came to them with evident proofs, they said, “This isevident sorcery1.”

f.81322: Qira’at: Hamza, Al-Kesa’i and Khalaf read it as: “‘This is an evident sorcerer .’”

61:7.t: And who is more unjust than one who fabricated lies against Allah when he was being invited to Islam? Thus Allah does not guide the unjust people.

61:8.t: They want to extinguish Allah’s Light with their mouths, but Allah shall perfect His Light, even though the deniers hate it.

61:9.t: It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over all religion, even though the pagans hate it.

61:10.t: O you who have attained faith, shall I inform you of a bargain that willsave1you from a painful punishment?

f.81323: Qira’at: Ibn ʻAmer read it as: “. . . that will deliver you from . . .”

61:11.t: That youplbelieve in Allah and His Messenger, and strive in the way of Allah with your wealth and yourselves; that is better for you, if you only knew—

61:12.t: He will forgive youplyour misdeeds and will enter you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and into beautiful residences in the Gardens of Eden; that is the great triumph.

61:13.t: And something else youpllove: support from Allah and an imminent conquest. So give glad tidings to the believers.

61:14.t: O you who have attained faith, bethe supporters1ofAllah as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples, “Who are my supporters towards Allah?” The disciples said, “We are the supporters of Allah.” Then a faction of the Children of Israel attained faith while another faction denied it, and We aided those who had attained faith against their enemy, so they came to prevail.

f.81324: Qira’at: Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir, Abu ʻAmr and Abu Jaʻfar read it as: “. . . be supporters for Allah . . .”

62:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth highly exalts Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

62:2.t: It is He who sent among the gentiles<sup foot_note="81325">1</sup>a messenger from among themselves, reading His signs<sup foot_note="81326">2</sup>to them and purifying them and teaching them the Scripture and wisdom—although they were indeed in evident misguidance before that—

f.81326: The Arabic word used isayat(singularayah). Ayahmeans ‘sign’ or ‘proof’. It is also used to denote the unit of text in the Qur’an,like ‘verse’ in poetry or ‘sentence’ in prose.Each such unit isconsidered a ‘sign’from God.

62:3.t: and(to)others of them who have not yet joined them1. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.

62:4.t: That is Allah’s grace which He brings to whomever He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

62:5.t: The likeness of those who were made to carry(the responsibility of)the Torah but then failed to carry it is as the likeness of the donkey carrying tomes. How miserable is the example of the people who rejected Allah’s signs, for Allah does not guide the unjust people.

62:6.t: Saysg, “O you who have Judaized, if you claim to be the allies of Allah apart from(the rest of)mankind, then wish for death if you are truthful.”

62:7.t: But they will not wish for it ever due to what their hands have put forth, and Allah is All-Knowing of the unjust.

62:8.t: Saysg, “Indeed, the death from which youplflee—it is bound to encounter you, then you will be returned to the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, and He will inform you of what you used to do.”

62:9.t: O you who have attained faith, when the call to prayer is made on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave aside all selling; that is better for you if you only knew.

62:10.t: Then when the prayer is concluded, disperse through the land and seek Allah’s grace and remember Allah much, that youplmay succeed.

62:11.t: Yet whenever they1come across a bargain or distraction they scramble towards it and leave yousgstanding. Say, “What is with Allah is better than(any)distraction or bargain, and Allah is the Best of providers.”

63:1.t: When the hypocrites come to yousg, they say, “We bear witness that you are most surely Allah’s Messenger.” And Allah knows that you are most surely His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are most surely liars:

63:2.t: they have taken their oaths as a cover, and so they have barred(others)from the way of Allah; indeed, evil is what they have been doing.

63:3.t: That is because they believed then they denied, so their hearts were sealed—thus they do not comprehend.

63:4.t: Yet when yousgsee them, their physiques impress you, and when they speak, you listen to what they say. They are like propped-up timber; they think every shout is aimed at them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. MayAllah strike them down! How can they be averted(from the truth)?

63:5.t: And when it is said to them, “Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you,” theykeep turning1their heads aside and yousgsee them turning away while acting arrogantly.

f.81329: Qira’at: Nafieʻ and Rouh read it as: “. . . they turn their heads . . .”

63:6.t: It is the same for them whether yousgask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them—Allah will not forgive them; indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

63:7.t: It is they who say: “Do not spend anything on those who side with Allah’s Messenger, that they may disperse.” And to Allah belong the treasuries of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not comprehend.

63:8.t: They say, “If we return to al-Madinah, the mightier ones will surely evict the inferior ones.” But might belongs to Allah and His Messenger and the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

63:9.t: O you who have attained faith, let neither your wealth nor your children distract you from the remembrance of Allah, and whoever does that—then those are the losers.

63:10.t: And spend from what We have provided for youplbefore death approaches one of you, whereupon he says, “My Lord, if only You would delay me for a short while so that I may donate and become of the righteous!”

63:11.t: But Allah will not delay a soul when its time has come, for Allah is All-Aware of whatyoupldo1.

f.81330: Qira’at: Shuʻba read it as: “. . . what they do .”

64:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth highly exalts Allah; to Him belongs the dominion and to Him all praise is due, and He is All-Powerful over everything.

64:2.t: It is He Who created you: so some of you are deniers and some of you are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

64:3.t: He created the heavens and the earth with truth, and He designed youpland perfected your designs, and to Him is the destiny.

64:4.t: He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and He knows whatever youplkeep secret and whatever you make public. For Allah is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests.

64:5.t: Has the news not reached youplof those who denied before, so they tasted the grievous consequences of their affairs? For for them is a painful punishment.

64:6.t: That is because their messengers came to them with evident proofs, but they said, “Are human beings going to guide us?” So they denied and turned away, but Allah had no need(for anyone), for Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

64:7.t: Those who have denied have claimed that they will not be resurrected. Saysg, “Yes indeed, by my Lord, youplwill be resurrected, then you will be informed of whatever you did, for that is easy for Allah.”

64:8.t: So have faith in Allah and His Messenger and the Light<sup foot_note="81331">1</sup>which We have sent down. For Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

64:9.t: The day whenHe1gathersyouplfor the Day of Gathering—that is the Day of Mutual Loss and Gain. And whoever attains faith in Allah and acts righteously,He2will remit his evil deeds and Hewill enter himinto Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever; that is the great triumph.

f.81332: Qira’at: Yaʻqub read it as: “The day when We gather you . . .”
f.81333: Qira’at: Nafieʻ, Ibn ʻAmer and Abu Jaʻfar read it as: “. . . We will remit his evil deeds and We will enter him into . . .”

64:10.t: But those who denied and rejected Our signs—those are the fellows of the Fire, abiding therein, and what a miserable destiny!

64:11.t: No disaster occurs except by Allah’s leave. And whoever believes in Allah—He guides his heart. For Allah is All-Knowing of everything.

64:12.t: So obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if youplturn away, then surely Our Messenger’s onlyduty is evident proclamation.

64:13.t: Allah—there is no god but He. So in Allah let the believers place their trust.

64:14.t: O you who have attained faith, indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive—then indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

64:15.t: Indeed, your wealth and your children are but a means of trial, while with Allah is a great reward.

64:16.t: So be mindful of Allah as much as youplcan, and listen and obey and give(in charity)for your own good. For whoever is protected from the stinginess of his(inner)self—those are the successful.

64:17.t: If youpllend Allah a good loan, He will multiply it for you and will forgive you, for Allah is Ever Thankful, Forbearing—

64:18.t: the Knower of the hidden realm and the manifest, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

65:1.t: O Prophet, when youpldivorce1women, then divorce them at a time when their(waiting)period can properly start, and calculate the period carefully. And be mindful of Allah, yourplLord. Do not evict them from their houses nor shall they depart, unless they have committed anevident obscenity2. Those are the limits of Allah, and whoever oversteps Allah’s limits, then he has surely been unjust to himself. Yousgnever know—Allah may afterwards bring about a new matter.

f.81334: It is obvious from the masculine plural pronoun that the Qur’an is addressing men.
f.81335: Qira’at: Ibn Kathir and Shuʻba read it as: “. . . committed an evidenced obscenity.”

65:2.t: Once they have reached their term, either retainplthem in accordance with what is fair or separate from them in accordance with what is fair. And call to witness two just people from among you and give upright testimony for Allah. That is to admonish whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, for whoever is mindful of Allah—He will make for him a way out(of every difficulty)

65:3.t: and will provide for him from where he never expects, and whoever places his trust in Allah—He will suffice him. Allah shall indeed conclude His decreed matters; Allah has set a due measure for everything.

65:4.t: And those of your womenwho have despaired of(further)menstruation—if you have any doubts, their(waiting)period shall be three months, and also for those who have not menstruated1. And those who are pregnant—their term shall be until they have delivered. And whoever is mindful of Allah—He will ease his affairs.

f.81336: Puberty is a condition for marriage in Islam; some women do not menstruate because of abnormalities of the reproductive tract.

65:5.t: That is Allah’s command which He has sent down to youpl. And whoever is mindful of Allah—He will remit his evil deeds and amplify his reward.

65:6.t: Allow them1to reside where youplhave been residing according to your means, and do not harass them to make things difficult for them. And if they are pregnant, spend for them until they deliver. And if they nurse your infant, pay them their reward and conduct your relation in accordance with what is fair. But if you disagree, then another woman will nurse him.

65:7.t: The wealthy one shall spend according to his means, and the one whose resources have been restrained shall spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah never tasks any self beyond what He has brought it; Allah shall bring ease after hardship.

65:8.t: And how many a town has defied the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We held it to a strict reckoning and We punished it with a dreadful punishment:

65:9.t: it tasted the grievous consequence of its affairs, and the consequence of its affairs was perdition.

65:10.t: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment, so beware of Allah, O you who possess intellect and have attained faith. Allah has sent down to you a Reminder—

65:11.t: a messenger who reads to you Allah’s signs1,(which are)clarifying2, in order to bring out those who have attained faith and have done righteous deeds from darkness into light. And whoever believes in Allah and acts righteously—He3will enter himinto Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever; Allah has surely given him an excellent provision.

f.81338: The Arabic word used is ayat(singular ayah). Ayahmeans ‘sign’ or ‘proof’. It is also used to denote the unit of text in the Qur’an, like ‘verse’ in poetry or ‘sentence’ in prose. Each such unit is considered a ‘sign’ from God.
f.81339: Qira’at: Nafieʻ, Ibn kathir, Abu ʻAmr, Shuʻba, Abu Jaʻfar and Yaʻqub read it as: “. . . Allah’s signs, clarified . . .”
f.81340: Qira’at: Nafieʻ, Ibn ʻAmer and Abu Jaʻfar read it as: “. . . We will enter him into . . .”

65:12.t: Allah is He Who created seven heavens, and their like of earth. The command descends between them so that youplmay know that Allah is Powerful over everything and that Allah has encompassed everything in knowledge.

66:1.t: O Prophet, why do you prohibit what Allah has permitted for you,seeking to please your spouses? Yet Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Bestowing of mercy.

66:2.t: Allah has already ordained for youplthe dissolution of your oaths, for Allah is your Patron, and He is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

66:3.t: And recall when the Prophet confided a matter to some of his spouses, then as soon as one(of them)disclosed it(to another wife)and Allah made it known to him, hecommunicatedpart of it1and disregarded another part. Then, when he informed her of it, she said, “Who informed you of this?” He said, “The All-Knowing, the All-Aware informed me.”

f.81341: Qira’at: Al-Kesa’i read it as: “. . . he harbored part of it and disregarded another part.”

66:4.t: If youdlrepent1to Allah, then your hearts have listened. But if both of you band together against him, then Allah is his Patron, as are Gabriel and the righteous believers. And, in addition, the angels will back him.

f.81342: Addressing two of the wives of the Prophet (peace be upon him): the one who disclosed the secret and the one who listened to her.

66:5.t: Perhaps, if he divorces1youpl, his Lord will give him in exchange better spouses than you: Muslim2, believing, devout, repentant, given to worshiping, given to fasting—whether previously married or virgins.

f.81343: The Qur’an is addressing all the wives of the Prophet (peace be upon him) using the feminine plural pronoun.
f.81344: The Arabic word Muslimāt (feminine and plural form of Muslim)means women who willingly submit to God.

66:6.t: O you who have attained faith, shield yourselves and your families from a fire whose fuel is people and stones; over it are fierce and powerful angels who never disobey Allah in anything He commands them, and they carry out whatever they are commanded.

66:7.t: O you who have denied, make no excuses today; indeed, you are only being repaid for what you used to do.

66:8.t: O you who have attained faith, repent to Allahwith sincere1repentance; hopefully your Lord will remit your evil deeds and enter you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, on the day when Allah will never disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. With their light streaming before them and to their right, they say, “Our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us; You are indeed All-Powerful over everything.”

f.81345: Qira’at: Shuʻba read it as: “. . . repent to Allah with a repentance of sincerity . . .”

66:9.t: O Prophet, strive hard against the deniers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them. And their shelter is Hell, and what a miserable destiny!

66:10.t: Allah has set forth a parable for those who denied: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot; they were under two servants of Our righteous servants but they betrayed them, so they availed them nothing against Allah, and it was said, “Enter the Fire with those who are entering.”

66:11.t: And Allah has set forth a parable for those who have attained faith: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, “My Lord, build for me, with you, a house in the Garden(of Paradise), and deliver me from Pharaoh and his actions, and deliver me from the unjust people.”

66:12.t: And Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, and so We breathed into her of Our Spirit, and she believed in her Lord’s Words andHis Scriptures1and was one of the devout.

f.81346: Qira’at: All except for Hafs, Abu ʻAmr and Yaʻqub read it as: “. . . and His Scripture and was . . .”

67:1.t: Supremely Blessed be He in whose hand is the dominion, and He is All- Powerful over everything;

67:2.t: the One Who created death and life to test youplas to which of you is better in conduct, for He is the Almighty, the Oft-Forgiving;

67:3.t: the One Who created seven heavens in layers: yousgsee no discrepancy in the creation of the All-Merciful. So look again: can you see any splits?

67:4.t: Then look again and again—yoursgsight will return to you bedazzled and exhausted.

67:5.t: And indeed, We have adorned the lowest<sup foot_note="81347">1</sup>heaven with lanterns and made them missiles against the Satans, and We have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

f.81347: The Arabic word dunyatranslated here as ‘lowest’ is the same word used to describe the life of this world as the ‘Earlier’ Life, as it carries both meanings: lowest and earlier.

67:6.t: And for those who have denied their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and what a miserable destiny!

67:7.t: When they are thrown into it, they hear it roaring as it seethes—

67:8.t: it almost bursts with rage. Every time a crowd is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, “Did no warner come to you?”

67:9.t: They said1, “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we disbelieved and said, ‘Allah did not bestow anything from on high; it is youplwho are greatly misguided!’”

f.81348: Frequently the Qur’an addresses the events of the Hereafter in past tense; this grammatical shift should be pondered by the reader.

67:10.t: And they said, “Had we listened or reasoned, we would not have been among the fellows of the Blaze.”

67:11.t: Thus they acknowledged their misdeed, so away with the fellows of the Blaze.

67:12.t: Indeed, for those who fear their Lord though Unseen, there is forgiveness and a supreme reward.

67:13.t: And keep yourplwords secret or say them aloud—indeed, He is All-Knowing of what lies within the chests.

67:14.t: Would He not know whomever He has created, while He is the Subtle, the All-Aware?

67:15.t: It is He who made the earth manageable for youpl, so walk through its regions and eat of His provision, and to Him is the Resurrection.

67:16.t: Are youplconfident that the One in heaven will not cause the earth to collapse beneath you as it spins?

67:17.t: Or are you confident that the One in heaven will not unleash against you a violent storm? Then you will know what My<sup foot_note="81349">1</sup>warning is like.

67:18.t: And surely those before them disbelieved(as well), so how terrible was My condemnation!

67:19.t: Have they not seen the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them? None holds them except the All-Merciful; indeed, He is All-Seeing of everything.

67:20.t: Or who is this who is an army for youpl, supporting you, apart from the All-Merciful? Indeed, the deniers are in nothing but a deception.

67:21.t: Or who is this that will provide for you if He withholds His provision? Rather, they persist in defiance and aversion.

67:22.t: Is one who walks bent on his own face better guided or one who walks upright on a straight path?

67:23.t: Saysg, “It is He Who initiated youpland made for you hearing and sight(s)and burning hearts; rarely do you give thanks.”

67:24.t: Saysg, “It is He Who scattered youplon earth, and to Him you will be herded.”

67:25.t: And they say, “When will this promise be fulfilled if youplare truthful?”

67:26.t: Saysg, “Indeed, knowledge is only with Allah, and indeed, I am only an evident warner.”

67:27.t: But when they saw it approaching, the faces of those who had denied turned gloomy, and it was said, “This is what youplused toclaim1(would never happen).”

f.81350: Qira’at: Yaʻqub read it as: “‘This is what youpl used to (challengingly) call for .’”

67:28.t: Saysg, “Have you seen: if Allah makes me and those with me perish or has mercy on us, who then will protect the deniers from a painful punishment?”

67:29.t: Saysg, “He is the All-Merciful; we have attained faith in Him, and in Him alone we have placed our trust, and soonyouplwill know1who is in evident misguidance.”

f.81351: Qira’at: Al-Kesa’i read it as: “. . . and soon they will know who is . . .”

67:30.t: Saysg, “Have youplseen:if your water drains away, who then will bring you pure running water?”

68:1.t: Nûn. By the pen and all that they inscribe.

68:2.t: YoursgLord’s blessing does not make you a madman.

68:3.t: And most surely, for yousgis an unfailing reward.

68:4.t: And very truly, yousgare of great moral character.

68:5.t: Thus yousgshall see and they shall see

68:6.t: which of you is the demented.

68:7.t: Indeed, yoursgLord is He Who knows better who has strayed from His way, and it is He Who knows better of the rightly guided.

68:8.t: So do not obey the disbelievers;

68:9.t: they would like you to compromise, then they too would compromise.

68:10.t: And do not obey any despicable swearer,

68:14.t: Just1because he has money and sons,

f.81352: Qira’at: All except for Nafieʻ, Ibn Kathir, Abu ‘Amr, Hafs, Al-Kesa’i and Khalaf read it as: “Is it true that because he has money and sons, 15when Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Legends of the ancients!’? ”

68:15.t: when Our signs<sup foot_note="81353">1</sup>are read to him, he says, “Legends of the ancients!”

f.81353: The Arabic word used isayat(singularayah). Ayahmeans ‘sign’ or ‘proof’. It is also used to denote the unit of text in the Quran,like ‘verse’ in poetry or ‘sentence’ in prose.Each such unit isconsidered a ‘sign’from God.

68:16.t: We will brand him on the snout.

68:17.t: Indeed, We have tested them as We tested the fellows of the garden, when they swore to harvest it in the morning

68:19.t: Then a sweeping visitation from yoursgLord swept through it while they were asleep,

68:20.t: and in the morning it was as though harvested.

68:21.t: So they called to each other in the early morning:
